work.name: Dotphoton
highlights: Developing 3D scene quality enhancement using 2D pre-trained diffusion models.
Created unsupervised zero-shot segmentation algorithm leveraging self-attention masks from foundation models, outperforming state-of-the-art methods by 35% in F1-score.
Improved industrial manufacturing efficiency by developing an unsupervised anomaly detection algorithm that combines sensor properties with generative models.
Designed and developed Jetraw’s data loading pipeline to handle large-scale machine learning training on AWS.
Improved platform accessibility and user experience for developers by creating Jetraw’s Python interface.

work.name: Dotphoton
highlights: Led the histopathology research team in the SyReal project. Designed and developed DiffInfinite, a diffusion model sampling method that generated whole slide images with semantic segmentation masks from only 2% labeled data, improving carcinoma detection accuracy by ∼ 15%.

Developed a cost-effective framework for satellite model evaluation using synthetic data from labeled drone imagery, enabling robust benchmarking of machine learning algorithms without the need for real satellite images.

Improved model accuracy by 20% and enhanced reliability in medical imaging applications by integrating differentiable raw image data processing into machine learning systems, reducing dependency on large datasets.
